titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller, Laurance S. papers, Outdoor Recreation Resources Review Commission, RG 6
A Guide to the Laurance S. Rockefeller papers, Outdoor Recreation Resources Review Commission, RG 6 FA787

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-10-22 04:40:23 -0400.

did.unittitle: Laurance S. Rockefeller papers, Outdoor Recreation Resources Review Commission, RG 6

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: United States. Outdoor Recreation Resources Review Commission

physdesc.extent: 37 standard document boxes, 3 legal document boxes, 1 standard half document box

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: In 1958 President Dwight D. Eisenhower selected Laurance Rockefeller to head the Outdoor Recreation Resources Review Commission, a fact-finding and advisory group created by Congress. Eight of ORRRC's fifteen members came from Congress and seven were presidential appointees. Their assignment was to determine the outdoor recreation needs of the American people to the year 2000 and recommend policies and programs necessary to assure that the needs will be met. A year later funds were appropriated and the commission set to work.

ORRRC conducted the most comprehensive fact-finding study ever made in this field and the results were published in 27 volumes. The major findings and more than 50 recommendations were contained in ORRRC's own report, Outdoor Recreation for America, submitted to President John F. Kennedy and Congress in 1962. This report presented a five-point program designed to improve and increase recreation use of both public and private land and water resources, to make more effective use of existing recreation areas and to acquire new ones, particularly shoreline. This program spelled out proposals for a national recreation policy; a classification system for outdoor recreation resources; expansion, modification and intensification of existing programs; a Federal Bureau of Outdoor Recreation and a program of grants-in-aid to the states.

The ORRRC Report envisioned a "long-range sustained effort -- both public and private" to achieve the goals fixed for the nation in the outdoors. While recognizing the need for acquiring additional parklands, ORRRC stressed making more effective use of resources already available but overly restricted or not used at all for recreation. The commission also presented a strong case for providing natural, or open, areas in the first- step planning of the new communities that the expanding population would require.

The acceptance of the ORRRC recommendations was extraordinary. In the months following their presentation a number were put into effect by legislative action or administrative ruling. A new Bureau of Outdoor Recreation and a cabinet-level Federal Recreation Council was established, with the Bureau carrying forward many of the specific program recommendations.

Most significant, perhaps, was that the ORRRC Report engendered a new enthusiasm and awareness for conservation and outdoor recreation. Citing the commission's recommendations, state and local governments initiated new programs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection documents the creation, implementation, and general activities of the Outdoor Recreation Resources Review Commission from 1949-1964 with the bulk of the material dated between 1958 and 1963. The collection consists primarily of background material relating to members of the Outdoor Recreation Resources Review Commission, as well as correspondence between Laurance Rockefeller and his advisors, reports, studies, and speeches given by Laurance Rockefeller and others.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Outdoor Recreation Resources Review Commission papers have been arranged into ten series to represent a simplified version of its original organization structure:

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Special format items have been separated from the body of the collection and assigned a unique separation number, as noted. Requests to access open special formats should reference the unique separation number.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: RAC has title, copyright and literary rights to the papers in so far as it holds them.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated to RAC by the estate of Laurance S. Rockefeller, January 2009.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of biographical and organizational information about the Outdoor Recreation Resources Review Commission and is largely made up of background papers, bylaws, manuals, and policies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence between Laurance Rockefeller and key members of the Commission.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is divided into four subseries: Commissioners and Representatives; Advisory Council; Academic Consultants; and Staff Members.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted from scholarly access - contains personnel materials.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted from scholarly access - contains personnel materials.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted from scholarly access - contains personnel materials.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted from scholarly access - contains personnel materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence relating to various contracts and expenses, as well as budget information and appropriation planning.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of proposals, pamphlets, and correspondence related to different areas of interest to the Outdoor Recreation Resources Review Commission.

did.unittitle: Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historic Parks

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is primarily contains correspondence between Laurance Rockefeller and various government officials. There is also a large amount of material on Congressional references to the Outdoor Recreation Resources Review Commission as well as information pertaining to the Wilderness Act of 1964.

did.unittitle: Udall, Stewart L. - Secretary of the Interior

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains a variety of reports and studies that were either conducted by the Outdoor Recreation Resources Review Commission or used by the Commission for reference purposes. Most notably, this series contains the final report of Outdoor Recreation Resources Review Commission that was presented to President John F. Kennedy titled, "Outdoor Recreation for America," as well as the 27 volume series of reports that that were published by the Commission in 1962.

separatedmaterial.p: Special format items have been separated from the above listed file and assigned a unique separation number, as noted. Requests to access open special formats should reference the unique separation number.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of correspondence, public relation material, and speeches given by Laurance Rockefeller during his involvement with the Outdoor Recreation Resources Review Commission.

did.unittitle: Speeches - Statement before the Special Subcommittee on Deficiencies

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The General Files series is the largest series within the collection. It covers areas of interest to the Outdoor Recreation Resources Review Commission including various people, organizations, and subjects.

did.unittitle: Controversy - National Forest and National Park Sevice
Universities - Harvard - Land Use and Conservation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains agendas and transcripts of meetings held by the Outdoor Recreation Resources Review Commission, including meetings with the National Park Service and the Commission's Advisory Council. There is also a small amount of correspondence relating to meeting activities at the end of the series.

did.unittitle: Kennedy Message on Natural Resources, Recreation
